Scroll down to learn more. In This Article Psoriasis - A Brief Psoriasis is a relatively common skin condition. Its prevalence varies from 0 to 11.8 % among different populations. Approximately three percent of people in the United States and up to 2.8 percent in India deal with this condition that causes the skin to inflame, thicken and get a scaly appearance ( [1](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34190957/)). People suffering from psoriasis are often embarrassed by their skin condition besides being plagued by a variety of symptoms, such as pain, itching, cracked, [broken skin](https://www.stylecraze.com/articles/skin-fissure/), painful and inflamed joints, and [blisters](https://www.stylecraze.com/articles/effective-home-remedies-to-treat-blisters-on-your-tongue/) filled with pus. These symptoms can lead the person to turn into a recluse, shun social gatherings, get depressed and even have suicidal thoughts ( [2](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/labs/pmc/articles/PMC3890931/)). According to the [American Academy of Dermatology Association (AAD)](https://www.aad.org/media/stats-numbers#:~:text=Acne,to%2050%20million%20Americans%20annually.&text=Acne%20usually%20begins%20in%20puberty,experience%20at%20least%20minor%20acne), 7.5 million Americans have psoriasis. It is estimated that 80% experience mild to moderate psoriasis, while 20% experience moderate to severe psoriasis that affects more than 5% of their bodies. It is further estimated that 80% to 90% of people with psoriasis experience plaque psoriasis (raised red skin with silver-white scales). [5](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK448194/)). Frequently Asked Questions What is the recommended frequency and duration of homeopathic treatments for psoriasis? Depending on the patient's profile and condition, the treatment may range from taking medicines once a week to continuous nursing for weeks or months. The practitioner's approach to managing the disorder, its severity, and the patient's response to the treatment are some factors that determine the duration. Are there any lifestyle changes or dietary modifications recommended for individuals undergoing homeopathic treatment for psoriasis? Following a healthy balanced diet with a regimen of exercise may help manage the disorder better. Your healthcare practitioner may recommend staying hydrated, keeping the immune system strong, keeping your stress levels in control, and avoiding triggers for psoriasis like alcohol and spicy food. Can homeopathic treatments for psoriasis be used in conjunction with traditional medical treatments? There is a lack of scientific evidence supporting the combined use of homeopathic and traditional medical treatment. You should consult your homeopathic practitioner and your healthcare provider to develop an effective plan to manage your psoriasis effectively. What is the success rate of homeopathic treatments for psoriasis, and is it a permanent cure? In small controlled trials, homeopathic treatments have shown better management of psoriasis and improved overall well-being [(6)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6693058/). Large-scale studies can give a clearer success rate of the treatment method in the future. Are there any long-term benefits associated with homeopathy treatments for psoriasis?
